description.narrative: Asia Network for Sustainable Agriculture and Bioresources (ANSAB) will support rehabilitation of monsoon flood victims in the district of Surkhet. From August 14 18, 2014, a massive and unpredicted monsoon in western Nepal caused flooding and landslides. Initial estimates have included 30 fatalities, 111 missing persons, 1600 displaced households, and the destruction of 6 suspension bridges over the Bheri River. There is a scarcity of drinking water in the area in addition to rural roads blocked by debris and electrical power outages. ANSAB will collaborate with government agencies and other organizations to provide immediate relief in the form of water food and shelter to victims. After these immediate concerns are met, ANSAB will assist communities by supporting livelihood regeneration efforts for victims.
